isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - Headlight System With Signal-Stat Turn Signal Switch, Push Button Dimmer Switch, With Canadian DRL, and Without International Engine

svcproc.title: Headlight System With Signal-Stat Turn Signal Switch, Push Button Dimmer Switch, With Canadian DRL, and Without International Engine

table.title: Headlight System With Signal-Stat Turn Signal Switch, Push Button Dimmer Switch, With Canadian DRL, and Without International Engine

entry.para: Remove fuse F26 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F26, and at circuit 14F measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (35) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
Bench test headlight switch (35) by placing switch in headlight on position, and measuring resistance from term. 1 to 2.
Disconnect connector (17) and reconnect connector (35). With headlight switch still on, measure voltage at (17) from circuit 51F to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51 or 51F, then repair.
Remove fuse F7 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F7, and at circuit 14A measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove relay (276) and at circuit 50E measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50E or 63, then repair.
Disconnect connector (421) and at circuit 52-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 52-GA or 11-G, then repair.
Test push button dimmer switch by placing in dim position and measuring resistance at conn. (421), from white wire to white wire.
Test push button dimmer switch by placing in bright position and measuring resistance at conn. (421), from white wire to white wire.
Reconnect connector (421) and with dimmer switch in bright position, at relay socket (276) and circuit 51-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-GA, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (17) and at relay socket (276), with headlight switch in headlight position, measure voltage from circuit 51B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51B, then repair.
Bench test dimmer relay (276) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test dimmer relay (276) by applying +12V to terminal 85, ground to terminal 86, and measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Disconnect conn. (17), re-install dimmer relay (276), and place dimmer switch in dim position. At (17), measure resistance from circuit 51B to 53D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 53D, then repair.
Place dimmer switch in bright position and at (17), measure resistance from circuit 51B to 52D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 52D, then repair.
Disconnect connector (2) and reconnect (17). With headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch in dim position, at (2), measure voltage from circuit 53 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 or 53B, then repair.
Disconnect connector (502) and (504) and reconnect (2). With switches still set, at (502), measure voltage from circuit 53B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 or 53B, then repair.
At connector (504) with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 53A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53A, then repair.
Remove fuse F31 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F31 and circuit 14L measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14L, then repair.
Remove DRL day relay (163) and measure voltage from circuit 66A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66A, then repair.
At relay socket (163), measure voltage from circuit 66A to 66-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GA, then repair.
Move key switch to ignition position and at (163) measure voltage from circuit 66 to 66-GA.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
At relay socket (163), install a test jumper wire between circuit 66-GA and 66C. Disconnect conn. (2) and measure resistance from circuit 66C [going to (163)] to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66C, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2) and at (502), measure resistance from circuit 66C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66C, then repair.
With headlight switch in the headlight position and dimmer switch in dim position, at conn. (504), measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GB or 11-GE, then repair.
Move headlight switch to headlight position and dimmer switch to bright position. Disconnect connector (2) and measure voltage from circuit 52 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52 or 52F, then repair.
With connectors (502) and (504) still disconnected and switches still set, reconnect conn. (2) and at (502) measure voltage from circuit 52C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52 or 52C, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) measure voltage from circuit 52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Remove DRL night relay (162) and at socket (162) measure resistance from circuit 66-GC to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GC, then repair.
At relay socket (162), measure resistance from circuit 66-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-G, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (168) and at relay socket (163), move test jumper wire to between circuit 66 and 66B. Move key switch to ignition position and at (168) circuit 66B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66B, then repair.
With air park brake released, measure resistance across switch (168).
Replace defective DRL park brake switch.
Reconnect conn. (168). Move key switch to ignition position. At relay socket (162), with park brake released, measure voltage from circuit 66F to 66-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (167) and move test jumper from relay socket (163) to relay socket (162). Place jumper between circuit 66-GC and 66D. At (167) measure resistance from circuit 66D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66D, then repair.
Measure resistance across resistor (166) which was unplugged from conn. (167).
With key switch in ignition position and headlight switch in headlight position, at conn. (167) measure voltage from circuit 66E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66E, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (166)/(167). Bench test DRL day relay (163) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test DRL day relay (163) by applying +12V to terminal 85 and ground to 86, and measuring resistance from term. 30 to 87.
Bench test DRL night relay (162) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test DRL night relay (162) by applying +12V to term. 85 and ground to 86, and measuring resistance from term. 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (162) and (163). Headlight and DRL circuits check good.
